t: Nahum 1
God Is Awesome
The*p oracle of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
A*pn jealous and avenging God is the Lord;*s The*ln Lord*s is avenging and wrathful. The*ln Lord*s takes vengeance on His adversaries, And*ln He reserves wrath for His enemies.

The*ln Lord*s is slow to anger and great in power, And*ln the Lord*s will by no means leave the*i guilty*i unpunished. In*ln whirlwind and storm is His way, And*ln clouds are the dust beneath His feet.
He*ln rebukes the sea and makes it dry; He*ln dries up all the rivers. Bashan*ln and Carmel wither; The*ln blossoms of Lebanon wither.
Mountains*ln quake because of Him And*ln the hills dissolve; Indeed*ln the earth is upheaved by His presence, The*ln world and all the inhabitants in it.
Who*ln can stand before His indignation? Who*ln can endure the burning of His anger? His*ln wrath is poured out like fire And*ln the rocks are broken up by Him.
The*ln Lord*s is good, A*ln stronghold in the day of trouble, And*ln He knows those who take refuge in Him.
But*ln with an overflowing flood He*ln will make a complete end of its site, And*ln will pursue His enemies into darkness.
Whatever*ln you devise against the Lord,*s He*ln will make a complete end of it. Distress*ln will not rise up twice.
Like*ln tangled thorns, And*ln like those who are drunken with their drink, They*ln are consumed As*ln stubble completely withered.
From*ln you has gone forth One*ln who plotted evil against the Lord,*s A*ln wicked counselor.
Thus*p says the Lord,*s “Though*pn they are at full strength*i and likewise many, Even*ln so, they will be cut off and pass away. Though*ln I have afflicted you, I*ln will afflict you no longer.
So*ln now, I will break his yoke bar from upon you, And*ln I will tear off your shackles.”

The*ln Lord*s has issued a command concerning you: “Your*ln name will no longer be perpetuated. I*ln will cut off idol and image From*ln the house of your gods. I*ln will prepare your grave, For*ln you are contemptible.”

Behold,*ln on the mountains the feet of him who brings good news, Who*ln announces peace! Celebrate*ln your feasts, O Judah; Pay*ln your vows. For*ln never again will the wicked one pass through you; He*ln is cut off completely.
Nahum 2
The Overthrow of Nineveh
The*pn one who scatters has come up against you. Man*ln the fortress, watch the road; Strengthen*ln your back, summon all your*i strength.
For*ln the Lord*s will restore the splendor of Jacob Like*ln the splendor of Israel, Even*ln though devastators have devastated them And*ln destroyed their vine branches.

The*ln shields of his mighty men are colored*i red, The*ln warriors are dressed in scarlet, The*ln chariots are enveloped*i in flashing steel When*ln he is prepared to*i march,*i And*ln the cypress spears*i are brandished.
The*ln chariots race madly in the streets, They*ln rush wildly in the squares, Their*ln appearance is like torches, They*ln dash to and fro like lightning flashes.
He*ln remembers his nobles; They*ln stumble in their march, They*ln hurry to her wall, And*ln the mantelet is set up.
The*ln gates of the rivers are opened And*ln the palace is dissolved.
It*ln is fixed: She*ln is stripped, she is carried away, And*ln her handmaids are moaning like the sound of doves, Beating*ln on their breasts.
Though*ln Nineveh was*i like a pool of water throughout her days, Now*ln they are fleeing; “Stop,*ln stop,” But*ln no one turns back.
Plunder*ln the silver! Plunder*ln the gold! For*ln there is no limit to the treasure— Wealth*ln from every kind of desirable object.
She*ln is emptied! Yes, she is desolate and waste! Hearts*ln are melting and knees knocking! Also*ln anguish is in the whole body And*ln all their faces are grown pale!
Where*ln is the den of the lions And*ln the feeding place of the young lions, Where*ln the lion, lioness and lion’s cub prowled, With*ln nothing to disturb them?*i
The*ln lion tore enough for his cubs, Killed*ln enough*i for his lionesses, And*ln filled his lairs with prey And*ln his dens with torn flesh.

“Behold,*p I am against you,” declares the Lord*s of hosts. “I will burn up her chariots in smoke, a sword will devour your young lions; I will cut off your prey from the land, and no longer will the voice of your messengers be heard.”
Nahum 3
Nineveh’s Complete Ruin
Woe*pn to the bloody city, completely full of lies and*i pillage; Her*iln prey never departs.
The*ln noise of the whip, The*ln noise of the rattling of the wheel, Galloping*ln horses And*ln bounding chariots!
Horsemen*ln charging, Swords*ln flashing, spears gleaming, Many*ln slain, a mass of corpses, And*ln countless dead bodies— They*ln stumble over the dead bodies!
All*iln because of the many harlotries of the harlot, The*ln charming one, the mistress of sorceries, Who*ln sells nations by her harlotries And*ln families by her sorceries.
“Behold,*ln I am against you,” declares the Lord*s of hosts; “And*ln I will lift up your skirts over your face, And*ln show to the nations your nakedness And*ln to the kingdoms your disgrace.
I*ln will throw filth on you And*ln make you vile, And*ln set you up as a spectacle.
And*ln it will come about that all who see you Will*ln shrink from you and say, ‘Nineveh*ln is devastated! Who*ln will grieve for her?’ Where*ln will I seek comforters for you?”
Are*ln you better than No-amon, Which*ln was situated by the waters of the Nile, With*ln water surrounding her, Whose*ln rampart was*i the sea, Whose*ln wall consisted*i of the sea?
Ethiopia*ln was her*i might, And*ln Egypt too, without limits. Put*ln and Lubim were among her helpers.

Yet*ln she became an exile, She*ln went into captivity; Also*ln her small children were dashed to pieces At*ln the head of every street; They*ln cast lots for her honorable men, And*ln all her great men were bound with fetters.
You*ln too will become drunk, You*ln will be hidden. You*ln too will search for a refuge from the enemy.
All*ln your fortifications are fig trees with ripe fruit— When*ln shaken, they fall into the eater’s mouth.
Behold,*ln your people are women in your midst! The*ln gates of your land are opened wide to your enemies; Fire*ln consumes your gate bars.
Draw*ln for yourself water for the siege! Strengthen*ln your fortifications! Go*ln into the clay and tread the mortar! Take*ln hold of the brick mold!

There*ln fire will consume you, The*ln sword will cut you down; It*ln will consume you as the locust does.*i Multiply*bln yourself like the creeping locust, Multiply*ln yourself like the swarming locust.
You*ln have increased your traders more than the stars of heaven— The*ln creeping locust strips and flies away.

Your*ln guardsmen are like the swarming locust. Your*ln marshals are like hordes of grasshoppers Settling*ln in the stone walls on a cold day. The*ln sun rises and they flee, And*ln the place where they are is not known.
Your*ln shepherds are sleeping, O king of Assyria; Your*ln nobles are lying down. Your*ln people are scattered on the mountains And*ln there is no one to regather them.*i
There*ln is no relief for your breakdown, Your*ln wound is incurable. All*ln who hear about you Will*ln clap their*i hands over you, For*ln on whom has not your evil passed continually?
